subject: The old barn
sentence: The old barn abuts the new commercial building.
paragraph: The farmer always admired the tradition in his old barn. Recently, there was a construction boom in the area with proposals for new buildings. The old barn abuts the new commercial building. The juxtaposition creates a unique skyline. Architects frequently come to study the area.

subject: Sarah
sentence: Sarah believes her friend's outlandish stories.
paragraph: Sarah met Lisa in high school, and they quickly became best friends. Lisa often shared tales that seemed far-fetched. Sarah believes her friend's outlandish stories. This trust strengthens their friendship. Often, they reminisce about their school days.

subject: The small park
sentence: The small park borders the bustling city square.
paragraph: In the heart of the city lies a serene haven for weary travelers. The small park attracts both locals and tourists alike. The small park borders the bustling city square. This offers a peaceful retreat. Families often enjoy picnics there.

subject: The renovation
sentence: The renovation cost thousands of dollars.
paragraph: The decision to refurbish the old theater was unanimously agreed upon by the board. It was clear it needed a fresh look. The renovation cost thousands of dollars. Nonetheless, it was worth every penny. The community now enjoys modern facilities.

subject: Jenny
sentence: Jenny dreads the annual dental checkup.
paragraph: Jenny has always been apprehensive about visiting the dentist. The mere thought of it gives her anxiety. Jenny dreads the annual dental checkup. Her friends always try to reassure her. Eventually, she manages to gather the courage.

subject: The kitten
sentence: The kitten fears the vacuum cleaner.
paragraph: The new kitten was very curious about its surroundings. It explored every nook and corner of the house. The kitten fears the vacuum cleaner. Every time it's switched on, it runs for cover. Gradually, it becomes accustomed to other noises.

subject: The old jacket
sentence: The old jacket fits Tom perfectly.
paragraph: Tom found an old jacket in the attic. He wondered who it used to belong to. The old jacket fits Tom perfectly. It felt like he was meant to find it. He wore it proudly on chilly days.

subject: The conference room
sentence: The conference room has twenty chairs.
paragraph: The office recently expanded its facilities. The new conference room is the highlight of the floor. The conference room has twenty chairs. It accommodates all team members during meetings. The staff values the extra space.

subject: Jake
sentence: Jake hears the traffic from his window.
paragraph: Living near the main road has its advantages and disadvantages. Jake appreciates the easy access to public transport. Jake hears the traffic from his window. It's a constant white noise in the background. Over time, he's grown used to it.

subject: Mary
object: the answer to the math problem
sentence: Mary knows the answer to the math problem.
paragraph: The students were discussing the challenging assignment. Every math problem seemed tougher than the last. Mary knows the answer to the math problem. Her classmates often rely on her insights. She's always eager to help.

subject: The city
sentence: The city lacks sufficient green spaces.
paragraph: Urban development has been booming for years now. But there's an issue that's become apparent. The city lacks sufficient green spaces. Residents are petitioning for more parks. They hope their voices will be heard.

subject: The battery
paragraph: Jane was preparing for her long journey. She packed all her essentials, including electronic devices. The battery lasts three hours. It's enough for her usual podcast length. She looks forward to the trip.

subject: Tom
sentence: Tom likes the new restaurant's ambiance.
paragraph: Last weekend, Tom decided to try a place he had heard about. It was a well-reviewed eatery downtown. Tom likes the new restaurant's ambiance. He found it cozy and inviting. He plans to visit again soon.

subject: The tourists
sentence: The tourists see the ancient ruins.
paragraph: The trip to Greece was the highlight of the year. The guided tour promised to be enlightening. The tourists see the ancient ruins. They marveled at the history etched in every stone. Memories of the trip would last a lifetime.

subject: Laura
paragraph: Taking a break in the caf√©, Laura enjoyed a quiet afternoon. The chatter around her was soothing. Laura overhears the secret conversation. It piqued her curiosity momentarily. She returned to her book, minding her own business.
